org.openbase.jul.pattern

Class AbstractObservable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openbase.jul.pattern.AbstractObservable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the data type on whose changes is notified
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shutdownable, Observable<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessageObservable, ObservableImpl

extends Object
implements Observable<T>

        source - the responsible source of the value notifications.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        This method initializes the shutdown phrase of this instance. All resources will be released. In case of any errors no exception will/should be thrown and the method will/should not block. These behavior guarantees a proper component shutdown without skipping any parts because of exception handling.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Shutdownable

      • notifyObservers

        public boolean notifyObservers(T observable)
                        throws MultiException,
                               CouldNotPerformException
        Notify all changes of the observable to all observers only if the observable has changed. The source of the notification is set as this. Because of data encapsulation reasons this method is not included within the Observer interface. Attention! This method is not thread safe against changes of the observable because the check if the observable has changed is done by computing its hash value. Therefore if the observable is a collection and it is changed while notifying a concurrent modification exception can occur. To avoid this compute the observable hash yourself by setting a hash generator.
        Parameters:
        observable - the value which is notified
        Returns:
        true if the observable has changed
        Throws:
        MultiException - thrown if the notification to at least one observer fails
        CouldNotPerformException - thrown if the hash computation fails

      • notifyObservers

        public boolean notifyObservers(Observable<T> source,
                               T observable)
                        throws MultiException,
                               CouldNotPerformException
        Notify all changes of the observable to all observers only if the observable has changed. Because of data encapsulation reasons this method is not included within the Observer interface. Attention! This method is not thread safe against changes of the observable because the check if the observable has changed is done by computing its hash value. Therefore if the observable is a collection and it is changed while notifying a concurrent modification exception can occur. To avoid this compute the observable hash yourself by setting a hash generator. Note: In case the given observable is null this notification will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        source - the source of the notification
        observable - the value which is notified
        Returns:
        true if the observable has changed
        Throws:
        MultiException - thrown if the notification to at least one observer fails
        CouldNotPerformException - thrown if the hash computation fails

      • applyValueUpdate

        protected void applyValueUpdate(T value)
        Method is called if a observer notification delivers a new value.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value Note: Overwrite this method for getting informed about value changes.

      • setExecutorService

        public void setExecutorService(ExecutorService executorService)
        Set an executor service for the observable. If it is set the notification will be parallelized using this service.
        Parameters:
        executorService - the executor service which will be used for parallelization
